result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defendant is being considered for Drug Court.
Bond poster req his bond money be returned.
Defense does not object.
State does not object.
BTC:  Bond posted by J.H. is to be returned.
From Mr. Hollow, re: request for bond refunded to him.  Fwd to all parties.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    ***TO BE CO-SIGNED BY: JEFFREY HOLLOW, D.O.B.-7/28/82.***  May not handle finances of grandmother.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is to be tested twice per week.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant must attend 7 self-help meetings per week while unemployed, and 4 per week when employed, and provide signed proof of attendance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defense req bond mod.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod in 15CF237 and 15CF550 to $5,000 co-sig bond w/ Jeffrey Hollow, DOB 7/28/82.  7 mtgs/wk while unemployed, 4/wk while employed.  All other conditions remain.
Bail/bond hearing on May 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  May not handle finances of grandmother.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is to be tested twice per week.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Kayla M Ingeman in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
